result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Karl Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin Karl Krueger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin Karl Krueger was found guilty of 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Kevin Karl Krueger was found guilty of Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

03:05 PM Defendant Kevin Karl Krueger appeared by video Zoom in custody at CCI.  State appeared by Special Prosecutor Mark Williams by video Zoom. Victim/Witness Office appeared by phone Zoom. Today's hearing is regarding the defendants multiple requests for documents.  Court addressed with the defendant the requested documents; he stated he has never received any of the documents.  State advised defendant to write to Court of Appeals or to get the file and discovery materials from his past defense lawyer.  Defendant is to be specific in his request for additional documents after he gets the file from his previous attorney. 3:22 PM
The time to order transcripts is extended to March 8, 2021.  The defendant's request to extend the time to appoint counsel was not considered further.

10:58 am Defendant, Kevin Karl Krueger, appeared in custody, without counsel.   Attorney Mark J. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicated he will plead.  Court questioned defendant.  Waiver of Right to Attorney filed; Court found that defendant is knowingly, freely, and willingly proceeding without counsel.   Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed; Court questioned defendant; Attorney Williams stated plea agreement.  Court instructed defendant as to consequences of pleas.  Defendant entered No Contest to Counts 1 & 2; factual basis is complaint and Attorney Williams stated in detail what the State expected to prove.  Court questioned defendant as to his knowledge of elements of the crimes.  Attorney Williams questioned defendant.  Court, after considering the record in this case, found there is a factual basis for the defendant's pleas and that the pleas are made knowingly, freely and voluntarily; Court accepted pleas, found defendant guilty on Counts 1 and 2, and ordered judgments of conviction on Counts 1 and 2; Counts 3 and 4 are dismissed.  Defendant requested an attorney for sentencing purposes; Court ordered a pre-sentence investigation; sentencing will be set.  12:10pm
filed by Atty Williams

09:07 AM Defendant Kevin Karl Krueger in court, in custody.  Special Prosecutor Mark Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is willing to discuss resolution, with Attorney Benavides assisting Mr. Krueger.  Court will recess until 10:00/10:22  Court resumed; appearances the same.  Judge stated Ron Benavides cannot assist defendant today per his employer.  Prosecutor Williams stated a stand-by attorney can be appointed if wanted; Court requested prosecutor put offer in writing.  Judge questioned defendant; prosecutor stated he can put offer in writing and present it to the defendant.  Written offer given.  Defendant would like to discuss offer with his daughter.  Court adjourned at 10:42/1:18  Court resumed; appearances the same.  Court discussed status with Attorney Williams and Mr Krueger.  Mr Krueger rejected plea offer at this time.  Court instructed defendant and counsel re: trial procedure.  2:25
for Submitting Evidence A Through L filed by defendant
Notice of Corrected Additional Motions in Limine and Corrected Additional Motions in Limine filed by Atty Benavides

11:36 AM Defendant Kevin Karl Krueger in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides and Attorney Luis Cuevas. Special Prosecutor Mark Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant had filed a letter regarding his relationship with counsel. Atty Benavides stated the defendant wants him to file some documents that he is unwilling to file. Atty Williams made a statement to the Court. Court addressed the defendant's motions with defendant. Defendant responded with argument for his motion and stated he will represent himself if needed. Atty Williams objected to defendant discharging his lawyers, with argument. Atty Cuevas and Atty Benavides made statements to the Court. Court found no misconduct of counsel.  Court questioned defendant as to representation; defendant wished to represent himself. Court reviewed defendant's waiver of right to attorney. Defendant stated he wants his trial to proceed. Defendant requested a change of venue. Court granted defendant's request to discharge the attorneys. Trial will remain. Motion to dismiss attorneys is granted. Defendant will represent himself. Atty Williams requested the Court order Atty Benavides to be present as standby counsel. Atty Benavides stated he is not permitted to be standby counsel. Court agreed with Attorney Benavides. 12:40 PM
of Additional Motions in Limine and Additional Motions in Limine filed by Atty Benavides

10:18 AM Defendant Kevin Karl Krueger in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides and Attorney Luis Cuevas.  Special Prosecutor Mark Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses defendant's Motion to Dismiss Attorney of Record, Atty Benavides states that defendant would like to continue working with Atty Benavides and Atty Cuevas, Court goes over defendant's rights with Atty Benavides/Atty Cuevas as counsel, Defendant states he wishes for counsel to continue to represent him, Atty Williams states he made an offer to defendant, Atty Benavides states defendant would like time to think about the offer, Atty Williams states he will give defense 3 weeks for decision, the defense will have until February 15, 2019 to advise prosecutor if offer made is accepted or rejected, Court addresses deadline by defense for the 11/1/17 Motion in Limine, Atty Williams addresses Sec. 2A and 3, also requesting a deadline to be set if there is an NGI plea, Atty Benavides is not ready to make a position, they would accept a deadline, Atty Benavides states they would like to get Dr. Mareks response, requesting until the end of April to respond, Court sets a deadline of April 30, 2019 for a formal response from defense for issues on Motions in Limine and NGI defense, State to have by the end up May for a response, #2 April 15, 2019 Jury Trial will be removed from the Court's calendar, the September 23 - October 4, 2019 Jury Trial will remain as scheduled, State calls Witness Lt. Detective Daniel Garrigan, Portage Police Dept., sworn, 10:55 A.M. testimony taken, Exhibit #1, Miranda Rights Form, Exhibit #2, Miranda Rights Form w/2:34 P.M. time stamp, Exhibit #3, CD recording of conversation with defendant on 2/15/16, Exhibit #4, Transcript of interview w/defendant, Exhibits 1, 2, 3, 4 marked by Atty Williams, moved and received, 11:29 A.M. Witness excused, Court in recess at 11:30 A.M., Court back on record at 11:35 A.M., appearances the same, Court reviews CD, Defense to file Brief by 3/22/19, State to file Reply by 4/12/19, Reply Brief by Defense by 4/30/19, 11:53 A.M.  Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2019 at 11:00 am.
